title: How to Make a Sock Doll

steps.title: Select three socks to make your doll.
steps.content: Select three socks to make your doll. They can be any size, but keep in mind that any pattern or logo on them will also be on the doll, so solid colored, lightly worn socks are best for this project.

steps.title: Stuff an ankle sock and stitch up the hem.
steps.content: Stuff an ankle sock and stitch up the hem . You could also use a regular sock and just cut off the top. The toe becomes the head, the heel becomes the rear end.

steps.title: Cut off the toe of the second sock and turn inside out.
steps.content: Cut off the toe of the second sock and turn inside out. These will become the legs.

steps.title: Mark the vertical center line to designate legs (with slightly rounded "toes" as shown).
steps.content: Mark the vertical center line to designate legs (with slightly rounded "toes" as shown).

steps.title: Sew
steps.content: Sew approximately a quarter inch from the center line on each side. Go up one side and down the other, rounding the toes. Leave about 1 inch (2.5 cm) towards the top. Don't go all the way up.

steps.title: Turn this right side out, stuff and stitch the top closed.
steps.content: Turn this right side out, stuff and stitch the top closed. These are your doll's legs.

steps.title: Sew together the hems (closed openings) of the two socks.
steps.content: Sew together the hems (closed openings) of the two socks . As you sew , make sure that the legs and the rear end are at natural angles.

steps.title: Cut off the heel and toe of a short sock.
steps.content: Cut off the heel and toe of a short sock .

steps.title: Turn inside out, draw the center line.
steps.content: Turn inside out, draw the center line .

steps.title: Sew a quarter inch from the center line.
steps.content: Sew a quarter inch from the center line.

steps.title: Cut apart as shown.
steps.content: Cut apart as shown.

steps.title: Turn the arms right side out, and then stuff and stitch them to the body.
steps.content: Turn the arms right side out, and then stuff and stitch them to the body.

steps.title: With a sturdy thread, sew 1/4 inch stitches around the neck and cinch them slightly to form the head.
steps.content: With a sturdy thread , sew 1/4 inch stitches around the neck and cinch them slightly to form the head. You can also tie a ribbon (the doll's scarf ) around to make the neck and give the doll a unique style.

steps.title: Use buttons, beads, googly eyes, yarn and markers to make the doll's face.
steps.content: Use buttons , beads , googly eyes, yarn and markers to make the doll's face.

steps.title: Add yarn hair.
steps.content: Add yarn hair. Wrap 30 or so strands of yarn around something sturdy that is approximately a foot wide.

steps.title: Place a strip of felt under the yarn, perpendicular to the wrap direction.
steps.content: Place a strip of felt under the yarn, perpendicular to the wrap direction.

steps.title: Hand baste the yarn strands to the felt strip.
steps.content: Hand baste the yarn strands to the felt strip.

steps.title: Turn the object over and cut the yarn in the center of the side opposite the basted felt strip.
steps.content: Turn the object over and cut the yarn in the center of the side opposite the basted felt strip.

steps.title: Machine sew
steps.content: Machine sew the yarn strands to the felt strip.

steps.title: Trim the felt strip ends.
steps.content: Trim the felt strip ends.

steps.title: Center the felt strip on the doll's head and sew it on.
steps.content: Center the felt strip on the doll's head and sew it on.

steps.title: Leave the hair smooth or braid it, as you prefer.
steps.content: Leave the hair smooth or braid it, as you prefer.

steps.title: Embellish with embroidery if you wish.
steps.content: Embellish with embroidery if you wish.

steps.title: Clothe your doll if desired.
steps.content: Clothe your doll if desired. This can be done by sewing something out of your fabric stash or purchasing appropriately sized doll clothes. Or, you could make the clothes so that they can be taken on and off easily.
